title: Disability access improved in Guernsey | Channel
text:
Dropped Kerbs at Crown Pier Guernsey states have installed a number of dropped kerbs and 'blister paving' to help improve disability access in the island.
The installations will make things easier for people with reduced mobility. The dropped kerbs will also assist people with buggies and pushchairs.
The States want to continue to look for opportunities to add this type of infrastructure as part of planned road works or as separate projects.
The sites where they've been installed include North Esplanade and Crown Pier.
Dropped Kerbs at North Esplanade Blister paving at Town Church It is great news we have made progress in enhancing accessibility. The improvements will benefit those with a disability or those with reduced mobility. Locals and visitors will be able to enjoy easier access across the island, more so within the town area.
